text.section:
The Department may deny an application for a food establishment license issued under this subtitle if the Department finds that the applicant:
Does not meet the requirements of this subtitle or any rules or regulations adopted under this subtitle; or
Fraudulently or deceptively attempts to obtain a license.

Within 30 days of receipt of the completed application, the Department shall notify the applicant in writing:
That the application has been denied;
The specific reasons for the denial of the application; and
If any, the actions that must be taken by the applicant to qualify for a license.

After a notice of denial is issued, the Department may issue a license to an applicant if the applicant:
Takes all actions specified in the notice of denial; and
Meets the requirements of this subtitle and all rules and regulations adopted under this subtitle.

An applicant who is denied a license is entitled to:
A hearing before the Secretary under § 21-316 of this subtitle; and
Judicial review under § 21-317 of this subtitle.
